arts.ttl: Tuchel questions Maresca judgement over James after England goal
arts.sum: Playing 90 minutes at right-back has been a rare occurrence for James in recent times but Tuchel insisted he was confident in the player’s fitness, having been in regular contact with Chelsea to gain insight into his health. Thomas Tuchel has hinted he does not agree with Enzo Maresca’s belief in Reece James as a midfielder after the Chelsea star netted his first ever England goal while playing at right-back.

arts.ttl: Liverpool's Harvey Elliott and Declan Rice react after seeing what Ethan Nwaneri did for England U21s last night
Thomas Tuchel makes Jude Bellingham admission after England win over Latvia
arts.sum: England followed up their 2-0 win over Albania with a 3-0 victory over Latvia at Wembley on Monday night, as new boss Thomas Tuchel made it back-to-back wins in his first two matches

arts.ttl: Roy Keane compares Reece James to England legend after stunning free kick against Latvia
arts.sum: Roy Keane compared Reece James to an England legend after his stunning free kick against Latvia in the World Cup qualifier on Monday night (24 March).

arts.ttl: Thomas Tuchel admits Jude Bellingham was 'lucky' after mistakes against Latvia
arts.sum: England came away victorious in Thomas Tuchel's second match in charge of the Three Lions as Harry Kane, Reece James and Eberechi Eze scored against Latvia at Wembley on Monday

arts.ttl: 'We will get there' - who were winners & losers for Tuchel's England?
arts.sum: BBC Sport looks at which players impressed in Thomas Tuchel's first two games - and who did not.

arts.ttl: 'Dull England show Tuchel's search for thrills will be no quick fix'
arts.sum: England's dull victory over Latvia shows new head coach Thomas Tuchel's search for thrills is no easy task, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

arts.ttl: Tuchel still searches for England’s conductor as Bellingham boils over | Jacob Steinberg
arts.sum: Substitution of Real Madrid star against Latvia shows head coach does not prioritise individuals over the team Everyone wants to have the ball when Latvia come to town. Everyone fancies the chance to take an extra touch. Everyone wants to be the star. Nobody seems to realise that slowing the play down is exactly what Latvia want as they settle into their rearguard action and focus on little more than keeping England out. It is a familiar problem for England. Thomas Tuchel has spoken about playing with intensity, about tapping into the aggression of the Premier League, about his team imposing their will on opponents. The challenge did not lie in defeating Latvia, but rather in how victory was achieved. Standards had to go up after a solid but unremarkable opening World Cup qualifying win against Albania. Tuchel is demanding. Tuchel will ask for more. Tuchel will not shy away from trying to rein in Jude Bellingham when the midfielder allows the unfocused, petulant version of himself to take over. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Harry Kane points to England improvements under 'fantastic' Thomas Tuchel in win over Latvia
arts.sum: Kane has scored in both of Tuchel’s opening wins as England boss

arts.ttl: Thomas Tuchel ‘didn’t want to risk’ Jude Bellingham red as England beat Latvia
arts.sum: The Real Madrid midfielder was substituted after a mistimed challenge on Raivis Jurkovskis while already on a yellow card.
